item_prototype.name: Admin status of port $1
item_prototype.description: "The desired state of the port. A management station may place the port in a desired state by setting this object accordingly. The testing(3) state indicates that no user frames can be passed. As the result of either explicit management action or per configuration information accessible by the switch, swFCPortAdmStatus is then changed to either the online(1) or testing(3) states, or remains in the offline(2) state."

item_prototype.name: Description of port $1
item_prototype.description: "A string indicates the name of the addressed port. The names should be persistent across switch reboots. Port names do not have to be unique within a switch or within a fabric."

item_prototype.name: Operational status of port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object identifies the operational status of the port. The online(1) state indicates that user frames can be passed. The unknown(0) state indicates that likely the port module is physically absent (see swFCPortPhyState)."

item_prototype.name: Bad EOF delimited frames received on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of received frames that have bad EOF delimiter."

item_prototype.name: Class2 frames received on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of Class 2 frames that the port has received."

item_prototype.name: Class3 frames received on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of Class 3 frames that the port has received."

item_prototype.name: CRC errors received on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of CRC errors detected for frames received."

item_prototype.name: Encoding or disparity errors in frames received on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of encoding error or disparity error inside frames received."

item_prototype.name: Disparity errors received on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of encoding error or disparity error outside frames received."

item_prototype.name: Frames received on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of (Fibre Channel) frames that the port has received."

item_prototype.name: Multicast frames received on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of Multicast frames that the port has received."

item_prototype.name: Truncated too-long frames received on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of received frames that are too long."

item_prototype.name: Truncated frames received on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of truncated frames that the port has received."

item_prototype.name: Words received on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of Fibre Channel words that the port has received."

item_prototype.name: Speed of port $1
item_prototype.description: "The desired baud rate for the port. It can have the values of 1GB (1), 2GB (2), Auto-Negotiate (3), 4GB (4), 8GB (5), 10GB (6), 16GB (8). Some of the above values may not be supported by all type of switches."

item_prototype.name: Frames transmitted on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of (Fibre Channel) frames that the port has transmitted."

item_prototype.name: Multicast frames transmitted on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of Multicast frames that has been transmitted."

item_prototype.name: Transmitter type of port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object indicates the media transmitter type of the port. The value may be: unknown(1) cannot determined to the port driver lw(2) long wave laser sw(3) short wave laser ld(4) long wave LED cu(5) copper (electrical)."

item_prototype.name: Words transmitted on port $1
item_prototype.description: "This object counts the number of Fibre Channel words that the port has transmitted."

item_prototype.name: WWN of port $1
item_prototype.description: "The World_wide_Name of the Fibre Channel port. The contents of an instance are in the IEEE extended format as specified in FC-PH; the 12-bit port identifier represents the port number within the switch."

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status {HOST.NAME} has changed on port {#SNMPVALUE}
